description.narrative: (Afghanistan): EQRA is implemented and managed through the Afghanistan Reconstruction Trust Fund (ARTF), administered by the World Bank. EQRA aims to increase equitable access to primary and secondary education, particularly for girls, in seventeen provinces, and improves learning conditions. EQRA's components: 1) Equitable access to basic education; 2) Improve learning conditions; 3) Strengthen education sector planning capacity and transparency; and 4) Technical assistance. EQRA is based on the USAID's Education Policy and the Ministry of Education's National Education Strategic Plan (NESP III) that aims to: 1) Increase equitable access to education for children in disadvantaged areas, especially girls; 2) Enhance the quality of teaching and learning; and 3) Improve the governance and management of the education system. EQRA contributes to the Integrated Country Strategy goal for economic prosperity by advancing social gains in education which contributes to stability and self-reliance. ..FY 2020 fund will support the rehabilitation of schools; teacher training; distribution of small grants for school classroom improvement; safe return to schools in the aftermath of the COVID-19 pandemic; community mobilization initiatives to increase enrollment in CBE classes; technical capacity building for provincial education, district education departments; school management Shura training; and replicating the early grade reading intervention in the remaining 29 provinces. Members of the school Shuras will play a vital leadership role in their communities by implementing positive traditional forms of peace-making, conflict resolution and reconciliation..USAID supports the ARTF as it leverages fiduciary reviews and performance monitoring tools employed by donors to mitigate risk; enhances donor coordination for financing and policy dialogue; and leverages U.S. assistance with other donors to support Afghan-led development...
